author: JamesWTruher
body:
for example this should probably work:
. $HOME/.powershell\profile.ps1

new-item $HOME/.powershell\foo
creates a file ".powershell\foo" in the HOME directory rather than a file "foo" in the $HOME/.powershell directory (additionally, it seems I can't remove this file from within powershell)

As "\" is a valid filesystem character, it may be that those paths need to be escaped in some way, but we need to do something - our current users use "\" or "/" indiscriminately
title: We should be agnostic with regard to "/" and "\" when dealing with paths
